channel.title: Global Retail & Commerce Monitor
channel.description: Real-time tracking of store operations, e-commerce tech, and consumer spending trends.

item.title: Circle Furniture Files Chapter 7 Bankruptcy
item.description: The 70-year-old retailer Circle Furniture has filed for Chapter 7 liquidation, citing insurmountable supply chain debts and a 20% drop in home goods spending.

item.title: Report: 15,000 Store Closures Projected for 2026
item.description: New industry data projects 15,000 brick-and-mortar closures in the US for 2026, doubling the 2025 figure, as "lease cliffs" hit legacy malls.

item.title: Pizza Hut to Close 250 Locations Nationwide
item.description: Yum! Brands announces the closure of 250 underperforming Pizza Hut dine-in locations as the chain pivots entirely to AI-optimized delivery models.

item.title: Canada: Retail Rents Rise in 37 of 120 Markets
item.description: CBRE Canada reports that despite economic headwinds, retail rents increased in 37 key urban markets, driven by a lack of new construction supply.

item.title: China Luxury Market Forecast to Rebound
item.description: Bain & Company forecasts China's luxury market will return to modest growth in 2026, though affordable luxury segments will outperform high-end heritage brands.

item.title: Bedrock Robotics Raises $270M for Retail Construction
item.description: Autonomous construction firm Bedrock Robotics secures Series B funding to deploy grading robots for large-format retail warehouses.

item.title: Saks OFF Fifth Closing 50+ Locations
item.description: Following parent company financial restructuring, Saks OFF Fifth will shutter over 50 storefronts to focus on digital luxury discount channels.

item.title: ISM Manufacturing PMI Hits 52.6%; Apparel Grows
item.description: The January 2026 PMI reading of 52.6% indicates expansion, with the apparel and textile sectors reporting their first growth month since Q3 2025.

item.title: Quebec Retail: Weekend Hours Expansion Approved
item.description: The Quebec government moves to finalize regulations allowing all retail stores to operate 6am-9pm on weekends, following a successful pilot in Laval.

item.title: GoodLife Fitness Launches Major Canadian Expansion
item.description: GoodLife Fitness announces a national expansion plan, taking over vacated department store boxes in suburban malls.

item.title: Circle Furniture Files Bankruptcy (Initial Filing)
item.description: Court documents confirm Circle Furniture filed for protection on Jan 30, listing $3.5M in inventory assets against larger debts.

item.title: 33,000 Retail Jobs Cut in One Week
item.description: A new report highlights that Amazon, Home Depot, and Nike collectively eliminated 33,000 roles in late January to pivot resources toward AI and automation.

item.title: Singapore: Tuas Port Phase 2 Reclamation 80% Done
item.description: Land reclamation for the next phase of the Tuas mega-port is nearly complete, critical for Asia-Europe retail supply chains.

item.title: Amazon 'Rufus' AI Assistant Rolls Out to Canada
item.description: Amazon's generative AI shopping assistant 'Rufus' is now live for Canadian users, capable of comparing product specs and tracking prices.

item.title: Amazon to Halt Palm Payments in Retail
item.description: Amazon announces it will discontinue Amazon One palm-scanning payments in third-party retail environments by June 2026 due to limited adoption.

item.title: Germany: Retail Sales Forecast to Grow 2.5% in 2026
item.description: Bain & Company forecasts a 2.5% rebound in German retail sales, though consumer confidence remains fragile due to industrial layoffs.

item.title: US Retail Media Networks to hit $60B in 2026
item.description: Retail Media Networks (RMNs) are projected to generate $60 billion in high-margin revenue this year, becoming a critical profit engine for grocers.

item.title: Aritzia Confirms New Vancouver Flagship at Pacific Centre
item.description: Aritzia will take over 40,000 sq ft of the former Nordstrom space in Vancouver, signaling confidence in the luxury-adjacent apparel market.

item.title: Europe: Private Label Share Hits 38% of Food Sales
item.description: Retailer-owned brands now account for 38.1% of all food sales in Europe (€352B) as inflation permanently shifts shopper loyalty.

item.title: Walmart Connect Canada Launches Ad Certification
item.description: Walmart Canada introduces a certification program for advertisers using its retail media platform, aiming to standardize performance metrics.

item.title: Taiwan: TSMC Kaohsiung Fab Receives First Tools
item.description: TSMC moves first equipment into its new 2nm fab, a critical development for the consumer electronics supply chain.

item.title: NRF 2026 Takeaway: 'Agentic AI' is the New Standard
item.description: The National Retail Federation's 'Big Show' concluded with a consensus that autonomous AI agents will handle 30% of customer service queries by year-end.

item.title: Target Announces 'Generative Search' for App
item.description: Target unveils a new semantic search feature for its mobile app, allowing users to search for "birthday party for a 5 year old" with curated results.

item.title: Costco Membership Fee Income Rises 14%
item.description: Costco reports a 14% surge in membership fee income, attributing it to affluent consumers "trading down" to bulk buying.

item.title: US Retail Sales (Dec Data): +4.9% YoY
item.description: December 2025 retail sales grew 4.93% year-over-year, defying recession fears thanks to a late surge in e-commerce spending.

item.title: Empire Co. (Sobeys) Closes Alberta E-Commerce Hubs
item.description: Empire Company is shuttering its dedicated e-commerce fulfillment centers in Alberta, pivoting to a third-party delivery model (Voila).

item.title: France: Carrefour Trials 'Smart Cart' 2.0
item.description: Carrefour begins a large-scale pilot of its next-gen smart carts in Paris, featuring produce weighing and instant checkout.

item.title: Report: Warehouse Automation to Hit $40B in 2026
item.description: The global warehouse automation market is forecast to reach $40 billion this year as retailers rush to solve labor shortages.

item.title: Amazon CES 2026: 'Ambient AI' for Retail
item.description: At CES, Amazon showcased "Ambient AI" that works in the background of physical stores to predict inventory gaps before they happen.

item.title: CES 2026: Samsung 'Ballie' Robot Personal Shopper
item.description: Samsung demonstrated an updated 'Ballie' robot capable of projecting shopping lists and guiding users through virtual store aisles.

item.title: Microsoft Launches 'Agentic AI' for Retailers
item.description: Microsoft announces a suite of "Agentic AI" tools that allow retailers to automate complex workflows like vendor negotiations and catalog management.

item.title: Shopify Rolls Out 'Copilot Checkout'
item.description: Shopify merchants can now enable "Copilot Checkout," allowing customers to buy products directly within an AI chat conversation.

item.title: UK: Retail Sales Forecast to Grow 2% in 2026
item.description: Despite inflation at 3.2%, UK retail volume growth is expected to turn positive (+2%) for the first time in three years.

item.title: Tiffany & Co. Opens Flagship in Montreal
item.description: Tiffany & Co. has opened its new flagship at the Royalmount mall in Montreal, reinforcing its luxury commitment to the Canadian market.

item.title: India: Budget 2026 Proposes Data Center Tax Holiday
item.description: To boost e-commerce infrastructure, India proposes a tax holiday for foreign data center investments until 2047.

item.title: Bain Report: US Retail Growth to Slow to 3.5%
item.description: Bain & Company predicts US retail sales growth will decelerate to 3.5% in 2026 due to mounting consumer debt and political uncertainty.

item.title: Tim Hortons Reveals Top Orders of 2025
item.description: Tim Hortons released its annual data, showing a marked shift toward cold brew and plant-based milk options in urban centers.

item.title: Montreal: Sainte-Catherine St. Renovation Phase 3
item.description: The next phase of the Sainte-Catherine Street overhaul begins, disrupting traffic but promising wider sidewalks for retailers by 2028.

item.title: Lululemon Signs Lease for New Toronto HQ
item.description: Lululemon expands its eastern presence with a major new office lease in downtown Toronto to support its digital teams.

item.title: Primaris Completes $154M Calgary Mall Sale
item.description: Primaris REIT has completed the $154 million sale of Northland Village in Calgary, signaling a consolidation of its portfolio.

item.title: Quebec Retail: 'Les Ailes de la Mode' Revival Plans
item.description: Reports emerge that investors are planning to revive the iconic 'Les Ailes de la Mode' brand in vacant HBC locations in Quebec.

item.title: Canadian Consumer Confidence Remains Flat
item.description: Post-holiday surveys show Canadian consumer confidence remains unchanged, with 60% of households planning to cut discretionary spending.

item.title: US Tariffs: Impact on Consumer Electronics
item.description: New tariffs on Asian electronics components take effect, expected to raise retail prices for laptops and TVs by 5-10% in Q2.

item.title: California: 'Junk Fee' Ban Enforced for Online Retail
item.description: California's strict ban on hidden 'junk fees' goes live, forcing e-commerce retailers to display full prices upfront including shipping surcharges.

item.title: China: Alibaba Splits Logistics Arm for IPO
item.description: Alibaba moves forward with the IPO of its Cainiao logistics unit to fund global expansion.

item.title: H&M Launches 'Green Steel' Store Fixtures
item.description: H&M pilots fossil-free steel store interiors in Stockholm, aiming to reduce retail build-out carbon footprint.

item.title: Japan: 7-Eleven Trials Holographic Self-Checkout
item.description: 7-Eleven Japan begins testing contactless holographic registers in Tokyo to improve hygiene and speed.

item.title: Starbucks Unionization Reaches 500 Stores
item.description: The number of unionized Starbucks locations in the US hits the 500 milestone as labor negotiations continue.

item.title: Nike Direct Sales Drop 5% in Q4
item.description: Nike reports a surprise 5% drop in Direct-to-Consumer sales, signaling a potential pivot back to wholesale partnerships.

item.title: Best Buy Unveils 'Small Format' Digital Store
item.description: Best Buy opens its first 5,000 sq ft digital-first store in Charlotte, focusing on pickup and consultation.

item.title: Australia: Woolworths Automated Distribution Centre
item.description: Woolworths opens its largest automated distribution centre in Sydney to speed up online grocery fulfillment.

item.title: Brazil: Mercado Libre Doubles Air Fleet
item.description: Mercado Libre adds 4 new aircraft to its Meli Air fleet to ensure 24-hour delivery across Brazil.

item.title: Uniqlo Plans 20 New Stores in North America
item.description: Fast Retailing announces aggressive expansion for Uniqlo in the US and Canada for 2026.

item.title: LVMH Acquires Sustainable Leather Startup
item.description: LVMH acquires a mycelium-based leather alternative startup to bolster its environmental credentials.

item.title: Shopify Stock Jumps on 'Agentic AI' Rumors
item.description: Shopify shares rose 4% following leaks about its upcoming AI agent capabilities (confirmed later in Jan).

item.title: South Korea: Coupang Raises Membership Fees
item.description: E-commerce giant Coupang increases its WOW membership fee by 20% to fund video streaming content.

item.title: Home Depot Testing 30-Minute Delivery
item.description: Home Depot pilots 30-minute delivery for small contractor items in Atlanta using Gig drivers.

item.title: Paris: Louis Vuitton Hotel Construction Update
item.description: Construction scaffolding comes down at the future Louis Vuitton hotel on Champs-Élysées, revealing the facade.

item.title: US Mall Vacancy Rate Dips to 5.4%
item.description: US mall vacancy rates hit a 4-year low of 5.4% as non-traditional tenants (gyms, clinics) fill spaces.

item.title: Inditex (Zara) Launches Pre-Owned Platform in US
item.description: Zara expands its "Pre-Owned" resale and repair platform to the US market to compete with ThredUp.

item.title: Mexico: OXXO Opens 1,000th Smart Store
item.description: FEMSA celebrates the opening of its 1,000th cashier-less OXXO Smart store in Mexico.

item.title: Wayfair Opens First Physical Store in Illinois
item.description: Online furniture giant Wayfair opens its first large-format physical retail store in Wilmette, IL.

item.title: Global Luxury Market Forecast to Slow to 2%
item.description: Bain predicts the personal luxury goods market will see soft growth of 1-2% in 2026 due to "aspirational shopper" fatigue.

item.title: Sephora Sales Hit $10B Milestone
item.description: Sephora North America announces it has surpassed $10 billion in annual revenue for the first time.
